meanings.definition: Relating to or affected by rheum.
meanings.sent1: The rheumic eyes were watery and red.
meanings.sent2: Her rheumic condition made her eyes constantly tear up.
meanings.sent3: The rheumic cat sneezed and left tiny wet paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a rheumic paradise, with dewdrops glistening on every leaf.
meanings.sent5: The rheumic morning air made everything look fresh and clean.

meanings.sent3: The rheumic flower petals seemed to cry tears of pollen.
meanings.sent4: The rheumic tree branches dripped with sap in the warm sun.
meanings.sent5: The rheumic candle emitted a fragrant, sticky aroma.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or causing discharge of rheum.
meanings.sent1: The rheumic cold left tissues scattered all around the room.
meanings.sent2: Her rheumic cough was loud and persistent.
meanings.sent3: The rheumic fountain in the park seemed to weep constantly.

meanings.sent5: The rheumic river flowed slowly, carrying bits of pollen and dust.
